intro: Eutrema platypetalum, commonly known as the flat-petal evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and prairies. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. The seeds are enclosed in a hairy capsule that splits open when mature to release the seeds.
